Multiple news outlets and blogs reported: providing information about the "No Lackin Challenge" and its connection to the shooting.
The: No Lackin Challenge" involves participants drawing guns on each other, with the term "lackin" referring to being caught without a firearm.
Local Memphis television stations: WMC and WREG, reported that the shooting occurred while the teenagers were playing with a handgun that accidentally went off.
Sherman Lackland: one of the individuals involved in the incident, confirmed to police that they were playing the "No Lackin Challenge" and the shooting was an accident. Lackland was subsequently arrested and charged.
